net.openhft.chronicle.map

Interface Replica.EntryExternalizable

  • Enclosing interface:
    Replica

    public static interface Replica.EntryExternalizable
    supports reading and writing serialize entries

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void readExternalEntry(Bytes source)
      The map implements this method to restore its contents.
      void writeExternalEntry(Bytes entry, Bytes destination, int chronicleId)
      The map implements this method to save its contents.

    • Method Detail

      • writeExternalEntry

        void writeExternalEntry(@NotNull
                      Bytes entry,
                      @NotNull
                      Bytes destination,
                      int chronicleId)
        The map implements this method to save its contents.
        Parameters:
        entry - the byte location of the entry to be stored
        destination - a buffer the entry will be written to, the segment may reject this operation and add zeroBytes, if the identifier in the entry did not match the maps local
        chronicleId - is the channel id used to identify the canonical map or queue

      • readExternalEntry

        void readExternalEntry(@NotNull
                     Bytes source)
        The map implements this method to restore its contents. This method must read the values in the same sequence and with the same types as were written by writeExternalEntry(). This method is typically called when we receive a remote replication event, this event could originate from either a remote put(K key, V value) or remove(Object key)
        Parameters:
        source - bytes to read an entry from
